sec.p: A total of 14 compounds from the garlic essential oil were obtained, 10 compounds were identified and 4 unknown which accounted for 97.54% of the total composition ( Fig. 1, Table 2, Supplementary Fig. 1). The primary compounds of the garlic essential oil were dimethyl trisulfide (19.86%), diallyl disulfide (18.62%), diallyl sulfide (12.67%), diallyl tetrasulfide (11.34%), and 3-vinyl-[4â€‰H]-1,2-dithiin (10.11%), followed by diallyl trisulfide (5.74%), allyl trisulfide (4.41%), 1,4-dimethyl tetrasulfide (4.06%), allyl disulfide (3.95%), methyl allyl disulfide (3.87%), and methyl allyl trisulfide (3.76%).
